issue.title: Requirements on function objects passed to {forward_,}list-specific algorithms

discussion.p: Some specialized algorithms for forward_list and list take template parameters named Predicate, BinaryPredicate, or Compare. However, there's no wording importing the full requirements for template type parameters with such names from and , which means, for instance, that there appears to be no rule prohibiting Compare from modifying its arguments, because we only refer to for the definition of strict weak ordering. Is that intended?

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4659.

blockquote.p: -1- Since lists allow fast insertion and erasing from the middle of a list, certain operations are provided specifically for them.259) In this subclause, arguments for a template parameter named Predicate, BinaryPredicate, or Compare shall meet the corresponding requirements in and .

-22- Requires: comp shall define a strict weak ordering (), and bBoth the list and the argument list shall be sorted according to this orderingthe strict weak ordering defined by operator< (for the first two overloads) or comp (for the last two overloads).

blockquote.pre: void sort(); template <class Compare> void sort(Compare comp);

p.del: -28- Requires: operator< (for the first version) or comp (for the second version) shall define a strict weak ordering ().
